It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Special Collections Librarian, Hoskins Library, University of Tennessee, 1401 Cumberland Avenue, Knoxville, TN 37996. (865) 974-4480.

bibl.title: [Legal] 1787 Aug. [to] The Sheriff of Greene County / State of Franklin
bibl.author: State of Franklin
bibl.note: This document is a legal writ to the sheriff of Greene County, in the state of Franklin (Tennessee) dated 1787. The writ commands that the tenements of Abraham Purnut pay eight pounds, four shillings, and eleven pence. This amount was awarded to Charles Hays in the court of pleas.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

address.addrLine: To the Sheriff of Greene County &c

div1.p: We Command you that of the Good & Challels Land, and Tinements of Abraham Purnut in yourBaclenich you Cause to be made the sum of eight pounds, five shillings and eleven pence Beredes Sheriffs endorsed ?. Which Charles Hays lately in our court of pleas &c recovered against for Court costs and charges &c Where if he is convicted &c and have you the send money ready and render at our next court of pleas &c he beheld for the county of Greene at Greeneville on the second Monday in November next — Together with this non witness Daniel Kennedy Clark of our said court at office the second Monday in August AD 1787 & Tavelfmr??? year of AmericanIndifirndc

row.cell: Received of the above Amount in Cash
